definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

sentences.english: Typical superclusters have many smaller clusters connected by these threads.
sentences.chinese: 典型的超星系团本应该含有成串的小星系团。
成串的汗珠挂在他的脸上。

sentences.english: Bananas grow in bunches on the banana-tree in tropical and semitropical countries.
sentences.chinese: 香蕉产于热带及亚热带国家，在树上成串生长。

sentences.english: Its color is purple or light green, and it grows in cluster.
sentences.chinese: 它的颜色是紫色或淡绿色，而且它生长成串。

sentences.english: Clusters of tiny insects called aphids were to be found on the underside of the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 结果在树叶背面找到成串的叫做蚜虫的小虫子。

sentences.english: They grow in bunches on vines.
sentences.chinese: 它的葡萄藤上成串生长。

sentences.english: Tears were beaded on her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她双颊挂著成串的泪珠。

sentences.english: The lesions may last four to five days prior to crusting .
sentences.chinese: 而这些成串的小水泡在出现四五天后开始结跏。

definition: very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
branches and tendrils/fig. overcomplicated or digressive
